meanings.definition: Tending to grab or seize eagerly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The grabby toddler reached for the shiny toy.
meanings.sent2: The cat's grabby paws swiped at the dangling string.
meanings.sent3: The grabby squirrel quickly snatched the nut from the ground.
meanings.sent4: The grabby octopus wrapped its tentacles around the coral reef.
meanings.sent5: The grabby child eagerly grabbed all the candies from the bowl.

meanings.definition: Having a strong desire to obtain or possess something.
meanings.sent1: The grabby collector always wanted more rare stamps.
meanings.sent2: The grabby entrepreneur was always looking for new business opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The grabby student eagerly raised their hand to answer every question.
meanings.sent4: The grabby artist's eyes lit up at the sight of the colorful paints.
meanings.sent5: The grabby shopper couldn't resist buying another pair of shoes.
